discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
AWS Marketplace is an online store where you can find pre-configured third-party software and services that are ready to use on Amazon EC2 instances. It offers a wide selection of third-party firewall solutions that can be deployed on EC2 instances to enhance the security of your infrastructure. These pre-installed firewall solutions can help protect your applications and data from unauthorized access and threats.

Selected Answer: B
Answer B: AWS Marketplace'

AWS Marketplace is a curated digital catalog that customers can use to find, buy, deploy, and manage third-party software, data, and services to build solutions and run their businesses.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/marketplace/latest/userguide/what-is-marketplace.html

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Marketplace
Answer is B
A- security groups act as Firewalls on EC2 instances
Option B - because needs instance that has a pre-installed third-party firewall.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to use an Amazon EC2 instance that has a pre-installed third-party firewall.

Which AWS service or feature can provide this solution?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer B: B. Security of the cloud infrastructure that runs all the AWS services

AWS is responsible for protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services offered in the AWS Cloud. This infrastructure is composed of the hardware, software, networking, and facilities that run AWS Cloud services.

https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/

Selected Answer: B
B. Security of the cloud infrastructure that runs all the AWS services

Selected Answer: B
AWS responsibility “Security of the Cloud” - AWS is responsible for protecting the infrastructure that runs all of the services offered in the AWS Cloud. This infrastructure is composed of the hardware, software, networking, and facilities that run AWS Cloud services.

choices.B: Security of the cloud infrastructure that runs all the AWS services
choices.A: Availability of AWS services such as Amazon EC2
choices.D: Security of customer environments by using AWS Network Firewall partners
choices.C: Implementation of password policies for IAM users

questions.question_text: What does “security of the cloud” refer to in the AWS shared responsibility model?

choices.D: Managing the operating system updates on the S3 bucket
choices.C: Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket
choices.A: Managing the infrastructure that runs the S3 bucket

questions.question_text:
A company wants to push VPC Flow Logs to an Amazon S3 bucket.

Which action is the company’s responsibility?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket

Even though all S3 buckets have configured encryption by default and objects are automatically encrypted by using server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed keys (SSE-S3) you can gain more control over the encryption by managing your keys. You can choose between server-side encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys (SSE-KMS), or dual-layer server-side encryption with AWS KMS keys (DSSE-KMS).
C. Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket

Selected Answer: C
C. Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket

comments.content:
"All Amazon S3 buckets have encryption configured by default, and objects are automatically encrypted by using server-side encryption with Amazon S3 managed keys (SSE-S3). This encryption setting applies to all objects in your Amazon S3 buckets.
If you need more control over your keys, such as managing key rotation and access policy grants, you can choose to use server-side encryption with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) keys (SSE-KMS), or dual-layer server-side encryption with AWS KMS keys (DSSE-KMS)."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/bucket-encryption.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is answer
C. Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket.
I belive - C

Selected Answer: C
Managing the encryption options on the S3 bucket

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. Managing the infrastructure that runs the S3 bucket.

comments.content: AWS manages infrastructure of S3. Customers have no access to it.

questions.question_text: Which guidelines are best practices for using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
The best practices for using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) are:

Create individual IAM users. This allows you to have more control over each user’s permissions and access keys.
Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users. This makes it easier to manage permissions for multiple users at once.
Option A is incorrect because sharing access keys is not a best practice and can lead to security issues.

Option C is incorrect because customer managed policies are more flexible and easier to manage than inline policies.

Option D is incorrect because granting maximum privileges to IAM users can lead to security issues.

Selected Answer: BE
Answer B and E: 
Create individual IAM users 
Use groups to assign permission to IAM users.

Option A is incorrect because sharing access keys is not a best practice and can lead to security issues.
Option C is incorrect because customer managed policies are more flexible and easier to manage than inline policies.
Option D is incorrect because granting maximum privileges to IAM users can lead to security issues.

Selected Answer: BE
B. Create individual IAM users.
E. Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users.

Selected Answer: BE
B&E answer
Answer: BE

Selected Answer: BE
To me B&E are correct. I don't understand why the solution is A&C. Can someone explain? Are the solutions proposed by this website reliable?

Selected Answer: BE
B&E are correct answers.

Selected Answer: BE
B. Create individual IAM users: It is recommended to create individual IAM users for each person or entity accessing your AWS resources. This allows for better accountability and control over access permissions. Each user should have a unique set of credentials to access the AWS account.

E. Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users: Groups in IAM allow you to group users with similar roles and responsibilities together and assign permissions to the group. This simplifies permission management, as you can assign or revoke permissions for multiple users by managing the group's permissions instead of individual user permissions.

choices.D: Grant maximum privileges to IAM users.
choices.C: Use inline policies instead of customer managed policies.
choices.E: Use groups to assign permissions to IAM users.

questions.question_text:
A company needs to apply security rules to specific Amazon EC2 instances.

Which AWS service or feature provides this functionality?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: Security Groups

A security group acts as a firewall that controls the traffic allowed to and from the resources in your virtual private cloud (VPC). You can choose the ports and protocols to allow for inbound traffic and for outbound traffic.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/security-groups.html

You can assign a security group to an instance when you launch the instance. When you add or remove rules, those changes are automatically applied to all instances to which you've assigned the security group.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/working-with-security-groups.html

Selected Answer: C
C. Security groups
